Protocols/BRSerializable.html#/c:objc(pl.name: -dictionaryForSerializing
Protocols/BRSerializable.html#/c:objc(pl.abstract: Retrieves a dictionary suitable for JSON (or other) serialization

Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.name: -didFinishScanning:withScanResults:
Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: Indicates that the scanning session has ended

Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.name: -didCancelScanning:
Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: Indicates that the scanning session has been cancelled

Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.name: -didOutputRawText:
Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: If BRScanOptions.returnRawText was enabled, this callback will be invoked after each scanned frame with raw OCR results

Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.name: -scanningErrorOccurred:
Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: This callback indicates an error occurred during scanning

Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.name: -didOutputDebugInfo:
Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: This callback provides encrypted debugging information that can be used to help identify crashes. For example, if the client app uses Crashlytics, this can be passed along as follows:

Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html.name: BRScanResultsDelegate
Protocols/BRScanResultsDelegate.html.abstract: Implement this protocol to receive callbacks from a scanning session

Protocols/BRSerializable.html.name: BRSerializable
Protocols/BRSerializable.html.abstract: All BlinkReceipt results objects implement this protocol in order to provide an easy method for serializing results into JSON (or other formats). You can call dictionaryForSerializing on any results object or sub-object and get an NSDictionary* that is suitable for serialization (i.e. contains no custom classes)

Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.name: BRMerchantSourceKnownList
Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.abstract: Text on receipt was matched against a list of known retailers

Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.name: BRMerchantSourceNameLookup
Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.abstract: Text on receipt was matched to a retailer based on external name lookups

Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.name: BRMerchantSourceLogo
Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.abstract: Text on receipt was matched to a retailer based on external name lookups

Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.name: BRMerchantSourceLayoutAnalysis
Enums/BRMerchantSource.html#/c:@E@BRMerc.abstract: Text on receipt matched common layout characteristics of merchant’s receipts

Enums/WFRetailerId.html.name: WFRetailerId
Enums/WFRetailerId.html.abstract: If retailer is known in advance, setting BRScanOptions.retailerId to one of these values can increase scanning accuracy.

Enums/BRMerchantSource.html.name: BRMerchantSource
Enums/BRMerchantSource.html.abstract: Represents a single method of identifying the merchant on the receipt

Classes/BRFloatValue.html#/c:objc(cs)BRF.name: decimalValue
Classes/BRFloatValue.html#/c:objc(cs)BRF.abstract: Rounded to exactly 2 decimal places for currency

Classes/BRSurveyResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.name: answersSelected
Classes/BRSurveyResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: If the survey question is multiple choice, this array contains the indexes of the answer(s) the user selected

Classes/BRSurveyResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.name: freeText
Classes/BRSurveyResponse.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: If the survey question is open ended, this is the text the user entered in response

Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.name: answers
Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Array of multiple choice answers to this question, if the type is BRSurveyQuestionTypeMultipleChoice

Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.name: multipleAnswers
Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Indicates whether multiple answers can be selected, if the type is BRSurveyQuestionTypeMultipleChoice

Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.name: userResponse
Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: The user’s response to this survey question, if the survey was completed

Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.name: -addUserResponse:
Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: When displaying the survey with a custom UI, call this method to indicate the user’s answer to this question

Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.name: -getNextQuestionIndex
Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: When displaying the survey with a custom UI, after adding the user’s response to the current question, call this method to get the next question index to display (since the flow may be dynamic based on the user’s responses). A return value of -1 indicates there are no further questions.

Classes/BRSurvey.html#/c:objc(cs)BRSurve.name: startDate
Classes/BRSurvey.html#/c:objc(cs)BRSurve.abstract: Survey start date, or nil if no start date

Classes/BRSurvey.html#/c:objc(cs)BRSurve.name: endDate
Classes/BRSurvey.html#/c:objc(cs)BRSurve.abstract: Survey end date, or nil if no end date

Classes/BRSurvey.html#/c:objc(cs)BRSurve.name: questions
Classes/BRSurvey.html#/c:objc(cs)BRSurve.abstract: Array of questions contained in this survey

Classes/BRShipment.html#/c:objc(cs)BRShi.name: status
Classes/BRShipment.html#/c:objc(cs)BRShi.abstract: The status of this shipment. For example “Arriving Tomorrow”, “Delivered”, “Refunded”, etc.

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: retailerId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For future auto-detect retailer functionality

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: blinkReceiptId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Unique ID for this receipt which allows BlinkReceipt to correspond scan data to the correct receipt image stored by client

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: products
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: An array of BRProduct objects representing the products that were detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: coupons
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: An array of BRCoupon objects representing the coupons that were detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: total
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The total detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: subtotal
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The subtotal detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: taxes
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The tax detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: receiptDate
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The purchase date found on the receipt formatted as MM/dd/yyyy, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: receiptTime
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The purchase time found on the receipt formatted as HH:mm, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: barcode
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The barcode detected on the receipt, if any.

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storeNumber
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store number detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: merchantName
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store name detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: merchantSources
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: An array of NSNumber objects wrapping BRMerchantSource values indicating which merchant detection method(s) succeeded in identifying the current merchant.

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: merchantGuess
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: When no merchant is detected using standard methods, the parser will occasionally return a best guess for the merchant based on receipt heuristics.

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: mallName
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The mall name in which the retailer is located, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storeAddress
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store street address detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storeCity
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store city detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storeState
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store state detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storeZip
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store zipcode detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storePhone
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The store phone number detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: cashierId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The cashier ID detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: transactionId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The transaction ID detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: longTransactionId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Some receipts contain a longer transaction number in addition to the standard one

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: registerId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The register ID detected on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: paymentMethods
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: An array of BRPaymentMethod objects representing all payment methods found on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: last4CC
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The last 4 digits of the credit card used, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: taxId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The tax ID of the retailer, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: channel
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The retail channel for this receipt, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ocrConfidence
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: An average confidence (between 0 and 100) for the OCR performed on this receipt

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: serverLookupsCompleted
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicates whether any server lookups were still pending at the time results were returned to the client

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: foundTopEdge
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicates whether a top edge was found on any frame that was scanned in this session

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: foundBottomEdge
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicates whether a bottom edge was found on any frame that was scanned in this session

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: subtotalMatches
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicates whether the subtotal matches the sum of the products and coupons

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: productsPendingLookup
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicates how many products were still awaiting product intelligence results when the scan session ended

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: isDuplicate
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicate whether the receipt is a duplicate (depends on BRScanOptions.detectDuplicates being enabled)

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: isFraudulent
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicate whether the receipt is believed to be fraudulent (depends on BRScanOptions.detectDuplicates being enabled)

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: duplicateBlinkReceiptIds
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If isDuplicate is true, this property contains the Blink Receipt ID(s) of the duplicate receipts

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: qualifiedPromotions
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If promotion validation is enabled, this will contain all the promotions that were validated

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: unqualifiedPromotions
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If promotion validation is enabled, this will contain all the promotions that were NOT validated

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: qualifiedSurveys
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If promotion validation is enabled, this will contain all the surveys that were validated

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: extendedFields
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Additional product fields

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptOrderNum
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For an Amazon or e-receipt order, this is the order number

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptOrderStatus
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For an e-receipt order, this is the order status

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptRawHTML
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For an Amazon or e-receipt order, this is the raw HTML that was parsed

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptComponentEmails
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For e-receipt orders, if aggregation is turned on, this property will contain the scan results objects from each component email for a given order. However, please note that for emails related to the same order that were originally seen in a different scrape session, the only property of the BRScanResults object that will be populated is the blinkReceiptId

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptPurchaseType
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For an Amazon or e-receipt order, this is the type of purchase

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptFulfilledBy
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The name of the 3rd party service (like Instacart) that fulfilled this order, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptSubMerchant
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The name of the sub-merchant (like “McDonald’s” for some Uber Eats orders), if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptPOSSystem
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The point of sale system used for this order, if any

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptEmailId
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The internal identifier of this email message from the provider

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: ereceiptAuthenticated
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether this e-receipt could be authenticated via DKIM or SPF headers

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: shipments
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For an Amazon order only, this is an array of all the shipments discovered in this order

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -addUserCorrectedProductWithBrand:upc:productName:imageUrl:totalPrice:quantity:
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For custom user corrections flow, if the user adds a new product, call this method to add it to this scan results object

Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -userCorrectedDate:
Classes/BRScanResults.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For custom user corrections flow, when a user modifies the date, call this method to update the receipt’s purchase date

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: retailerId
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If the retailer is known in advance pass in a value from the WFRetailerId enum

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: returnRawText
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether to return the raw OCR text. If this property is true, -[BRScanResultsDelegate didOutputRawText:] will be called

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: storeUserFrames
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether to write the user-confirmed frames to disk. If this property is true, after a scanning session BRScanManager.userFramesFilepaths will contain the local paths of the user frames. You are responsible for deleting these images from disk when you are done with them.

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: clientUsesScanditCamera
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether the client uses a Scandit camera independently of the BlinkReceipt SDK. If this is the case, BlinkReceipt will incorporate a fix to an inconsistent camera bug that occurs in this scenario.

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: debugMode
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether to store up all the frames that the SDK parsed for inclusion in the debug email after the scan

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: jpegCompressionQuality
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The compression quality parameter to pass into UIImageJPEGRepresentation for saving user images to disk

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: tooFarThreshold
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: This controls when the “Move Closer” message appears. The threshold is a percentage expressed as an integer between 1 and 99. If edges are detected such that the width of the receipt divided by the width of the full image is below this threshold, the “too far” flag will be passed to the client.

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: edgesEveryNthFrame
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: This controls how often edge detection is run on frames returned by the camera. Must be an even integer between 2 and 30. For example, setting this to 8 means edge detection will be run every 8th frame

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: detectDistanceWithEdges
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Controls whether edge detection is used to make determinations of user’s distance from the receipt

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: numGoodFramesToStopEdges
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The number of consecutive frames above the tooFarThreshold before we stop running edge detection

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: restartEdgesAfterUserConfirm
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If numGoodFramesToStopEdges is greater than 0, this property allows edge detection to restart after a user confirms a frame

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: enableEdgesAfterUserPhoto
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether the SDK should continue edge detection after the first user snapped photo

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: beginEdgesImmediately
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether the SDK should begin edge detection immediately at the start of the scan session (as opposed to establishing frame quality baselines before starting edge detection)

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: detectWrongRetailer
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether the SDK should attempt to verify that the user is in fact scanning a receipt from the specified retailer. If this property is true and the SDK detects a different retailer than specified, -[BRCameraViewController didDetectWrongRetailer:withConfidence:] will be triggered, which allows the client to determine if scanning should continue with the new retailer

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: detectLogo
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether to enable logo detection

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: manualTorchControl
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether the client will control the torch manually (should only be used with custom BRCameraViewController subclass). When this is enabled, -[BRCameraViewController didGetLightingCondition:] will be invoked to notify the client of lighting changes

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: disableOnDeviceProcessing
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If this property is enabled, the SDK will not perform any on-device frame processing

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: detectDuplicates
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If this property is enabled, and the receipt is detected to be a duplicate, BRScanResults.isDuplicate will be set to true. Also checks for fraudulent receipts and sets the BRScanResults.isFraudulent property

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: returnVoidedProducts
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If this property is enabled, voided products will be returned with the BRProduct.isVoided property set to YES

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: validatePromotions
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Whether to attempt to validate scan results against specified promotions

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: promotionSlugs
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: One or more promotion slugs to validate against

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: enableDynamicTextSizing
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If enabled, the stock camera controller’s UI will adjust based on the user’s text size preference from the Settings or Accessibility screens

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: previousFrameOverlap
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: This property controls how much of the previous frame is visible in the stock controller once a user has touched to add an additional frame. Specified in pixels

Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: returnSubproducts
Classes/BRScanOptions.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If this property is enabled, subproducts will be returned in the BRProduct.subProducts array of the parent product

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: licenseKey
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Your BlinkReceipt license key

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: googlePlacesApiKey
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Google Places Web Service API Key (for more info see: https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/get-api-key)

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: yelpApiKey
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Yelp API Key (for more infos see: https://www.yelp.com/developers)

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: prodIntelKey
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Your BlinkReceipt product intelligence key (if any)

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: clientUserId
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: A client-specified identifier for the current user

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: userFramesFilepaths
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: An array of NSString filepaths corresponding to the user images, if any, which were confirmed by the user during the scanning session.

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: daysToStoreReceiptData
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If users should be able to correct historical receipts, this controls how long the receipt data will be stored locally to enable editing

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: deviceCanProcessVideo
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Indicates whether the current device is capable of processing video frames

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: +sharedManager
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Always access this singleton instance

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -startStaticCameraFromController:scanOptions:withDelegate:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Initiates a static camera scanning experience (in which the user appears to be snapping static photos)

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -startCustomCamera:fromController:scanOptions:withDelegate:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Initiates a scanning session using your own subclass of BRCameraViewController which is presented as modal from the supplied UIViewController

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -pushCustomCamera:fromNavController:scanOptions:withDelegate:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Initiates a scanning session using your own subclass of BRCameraViewController which is pushed from the supplied UINavigationController

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -createMailControllerWithDebugInfo
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Creates a new MFMailComposeViewController populated with debug information about the most recent scan. Caller is responsible for setting the mailComposeDelegate and presenting/dismissing the view controller.

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -setActivationDate:forPromotion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: For purchase validation, use these properties to indicate the date a user activated a specific promotion

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -startReceiptCorrection:fromViewController:withCountryCode:withCustomFont:withCompletion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Begin the receipt correction flow for a receipt stored on disk

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -getResultsForReceiptCorrection:withCompletion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Retrieve resullts from disk or remotely for a specific receipt for custom user corrections flow

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -submitUpdatedResultsForValidation:withCompletion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: After custom user correction flow, call this method to validate the new results against promotions

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -getPromotionsWithCompletion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Retrieves targeted and general promotions for current user

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -getSurveysWithCompletion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Retrieves surveys for current user

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -startSurvey:fromViewController:withCompletion:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: Displays a given survey using the prepackaged flow

Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -submitSurveyResults:
Classes/BRScanManager.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: When displaying a survey using a custom UI, call this method after the user has completed the survey to post the results

Classes/BRPromotionInfo.html#/c:objc(cs).name: slug
Classes/BRPromotionInfo.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The promotion slug from the PVP dashboard

Classes/BRPromotionInfo.html#/c:objc(cs).name: targeted
Classes/BRPromotionInfo.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Whether this promotion is targeted to this user or not

Classes/BRPromotion.html#/c:objc(cs)BRPr.name: relatedProductIndexes
Classes/BRPromotion.html#/c:objc(cs)BRPr.abstract: If this promotion qualified, this property contains the indexes of the products in the BRScanResults.products array which caused this promotion to qualify

Classes/BRPromotion.html#/c:objc(cs)BRPr.name: qualifications
Classes/BRPromotion.html#/c:objc(cs)BRPr.abstract: If this promotion qualified, this property contains an array of each instance of qualification, and each instance is an array containing the indexes of the products in the BRScanResults.products array which caused this promotion to qualify

Classes/BRProductAdditionalLine.html#/c:.name: type
Classes/BRProductAdditionalLine.html#/c:.abstract: The type of this additional line. For example “Full Price”, “Price Cut”, “Quantity”, etc.

Classes/BRProductAdditionalLine.html#/c:.name: lineNumber
Classes/BRProductAdditionalLine.html#/c:.abstract: The line number of this additional line

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: productNumber
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product number (SKU, UPC, or other) found on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: productDescription
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product description found on the receipt, if any

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: quantity
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product quantity found on the receipt, if any (can be # of items or an amount if units are weight)

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: unitPrice
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The unit price (i.e. if the item costs $8/lb this would be 8.0)

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: unitOfMeasure
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The unit of measure for this item (i.e. pounds, ounces, packs, etc)

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: totalPrice
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The total price paid for this line item, taking into account quantities, weights, and discounts

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: fullPrice
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The total price before any savings were applied to this item (to compute the discount on this item, subtract totalPrice from fullPrice)

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: additionalLines
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: An array of any additional lines connected to this product that were scanned (can be above or below). This array can be nil if no lines were found

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: isVoided
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: Indicates whether this is a voided product. Voided products will only be returned if BRScanOptions.returnVoidedProducts is set

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: shippingStatus
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: For e-receipt orders, this indicates the shipping status of this product

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: prodDescPrefix
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The prefix found before the product description if any

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: prodDescPostfix
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The postfix found after the product description if any

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: prodNumPrefix
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The prefix found before the product number if any

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: prodNumPostfix
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The postfix found after the product number if any

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: fuelType
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: If this product is fuel, this will be the type of fuel (e.g. “Regular”, “Unleaded”, etc)

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: extendedFields
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: Additional product fields

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: productName
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The full product name

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: brand
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product brand

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: category
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product category

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: size
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product size

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: upc
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product UPC

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: probability
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: If this product is part of a different product’s possibleProducts array, then this property indicates an estimate of how likely this particular possible product is to match the description of the parent BRProduct

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: imgUrl
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: The product thumbnail URL (size may vary)

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: possibleProducts
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: If product intelligence is unable to return an exact product match, it may return an array of possible products. Each of these will have only the above product intelligence properties populated.

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: subProducts
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: An array of sub products tied to the current product, if any. Generally only populated for restaurants

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: userAdded
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: Whether the user added this product during the receipt correction flow

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: userModified
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: Whether the user modified this product during the receipt corretion flow

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: isSensitive
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: If BRScanOptions.filterSensitiveData is enabled, then this flag will indicate whether the current product is from a sensitive category as determined by product intelligence

Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.name: -userCorrectedBrand:upc:productName:imageUrl:totalPrice:quantity:
Classes/BRProduct.html#/c:objc(cs)BRProd.abstract: For custom user corrections flow, when a user modifies an existing product, call this method to update the product’s properties.

Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).name: method
Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The payment method (i.e. Cash, Credit, Debit, Gift Card, Check, etc), if any

Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).name: cardType
Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The card type (i.e. Visa, American Express, Mastercard, or Discover), if any

Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).name: cardIssuer
Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The card issuer (i.e. Target, Walmart, etc), if any

Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).name: amount
Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The amount charged to this payment method

Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.name: scanningRegion
Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.abstract: This property restricts the region in which barcode will be detected. The parametesr are specified as percentages of the view size. The default value is (0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0)

Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.name: countryCode
Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.abstract: Due to differences in barcode lengths, specifying the country code helps determine the correct barcode length the SDK should detect

Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.name: -didDetectBarcode:
Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.abstract: Override this method to be notified when a barcode is detected. Supports 12 digit and 6 digit UPC’s.

Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.name: -restartCaptureSession
Classes/BRMissedEarningsBaseViewControll.abstract: When a barcode is found, the capture session is automatically paused. Invoke this method to restart the capture session afterwards.

Classes/BRFrameAttributes.html#/c:objc(c.name: isReceipt
Classes/BRFrameAttributes.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Indicates whether this frame is believed to be an image of a receipt

Classes/BRFrameAttributes.html#/c:objc(c.name: isScreen
Classes/BRFrameAttributes.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Indicates whether this frame is believed to be a photo of a screen

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: couponType
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: The type of coupon based on the above enum

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: couponAmount
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: The amount of the coupon or discount

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: couponDescPrefix
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: The prefix found before the coupon description if any

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: couponDescPostfix
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: The postfix found after the coupon description if any

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: couponSkuPrefix
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: The prefix found before the coupon SKU if any

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: couponSkuPostfix
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: The postfix found after the coupon SKU if any

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: relatedProductIndex
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: If this coupon is related to a particular product, this property will be set to correspond to the index of related product in the BRScanResults.products array.

Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.name: +friendlyNameForCouponType:
Classes/BRCoupon.html#/c:objc(cs)BRCoupo.abstract: Convert a coupon type to a user-friendly string

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: scanningRegion
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Set this property of your subclass in order to scan only a certain region of the returned image from the camera. The values of the CGRect

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: isTorchOn
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Indicates whether the torch is on

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: isPaused
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Indicates whether scanning is paused

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: isEdgeDetectionRunning
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Indicates whether edge detection is running

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: manualCaptureSession
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Set this property to YES to prevent the parent view controller from starting and stopping the AVCaptureSession based on view lifecycle events.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -userSnappedPhotoOnReady:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Call this method to notify the camera controller that the user has attempted to snap a picture.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -userFinishedScan
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Call this method to notify the camera controller that the user has indicated they have finished scanning.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -getPreliminaryResults:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Call this method to invoke the same processing that happens at the end of the scan session.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -userCancelledScan
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Call this method to notify the camera controller that the user has cancelled scanning.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -userConfirmedFrame:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Call this method to notify the camera controller that the user has confirmed a particular frame. This will mark the frame internally as a user frame which allows it to be saved remotely after the scan session, and also saved to disk if BRScanOptions.storeUserFrames is set

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -setTorch:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Toggle the status of the torch

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -pauseScanning
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Pause frame capture and scanning. Any frames that are already in the processing pipeline will continue to be scanned

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -resumeScanning
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Resume frame capture and scanning.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -confirmCorrectRetailer:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: After receiving the didDetectWrongRetailer: callback, call this method to indicate that scanning should use the new retailer going forward

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -userDistanceChanged:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Override this method to be notified when a determination is made that the user’s scanning distance is either too far or is acceptable (OK)

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -didGetFrameStats:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Override this method to receive statistics on each frame that is processed

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -didDetectWrongRetailer:withConfidence:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Override this method to be notified when the SDK detects that the receipt being scanned is from a different retailer than was specified

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -didGetFrameResults:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Override this method to receive frame by frame scan results (note: metadata only, does not include product results).

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -receiptValidityEstimate:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Override this method to receive frame by frame estimations about whether the user is scanning a valid receipt (estimation is cumulative based on all previous frames scanned to that point)

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -didGetLightingCondition:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: When BRScanOptions.manualTorchControl is enabled, this callback will indicate to the client VC if the SDK detects a new lighting condition.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.name: -didGetHorizontalEdges:andBottomEdge:
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Override this method to receive a callback when one or both horizontal edges is detected on the current frame. Note: This does not guarantee that this frame will be scanned.

Classes/BRCameraViewController.html.name: BRCameraViewController
Classes/BRCameraViewController.html.abstract: Base camera controller class. Subclass to build your own UI on top of the fullscreen camera view

Classes/BRCoupon.html.name: BRCoupon
Classes/BRCoupon.html.abstract: Describes one coupon or discount on a receipt

Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html.name: BRPaymentMethod
Classes/BRPaymentMethod.html.abstract: Described a payment method and the amount charged to that payment method

Classes/BRProductAdditionalLine.html.name: BRProductAdditionalLine
Classes/BRProductAdditionalLine.html.abstract: Represents an additional line of text attached to a product

Classes/BRPromotion.html.name: BRPromotion
Classes/BRPromotion.html.abstract: Represents a promotion identified on the receipt

Classes/BRPromotionInfo.html.name: BRPromotionInfo
Classes/BRPromotionInfo.html.abstract: Represents information about a promotion retrieved for the current user

Classes/BRScanManager.html.name: BRScanManager
Classes/BRScanManager.html.abstract: This is the main interface for initiating scanning sessions

Classes/BRScanOptions.html.name: BRScanOptions
Classes/BRScanOptions.html.abstract: Create an instance of this class to specify the scanning options for a session

Classes/BRScanResults.html.name: BRScanResults
Classes/BRScanResults.html.abstract: This class holds the scan results for a particular scanning session

Classes/BRShipment.html.name: BRShipment
Classes/BRShipment.html.abstract: Represents one shipment in an Amazon order

Classes/BRSurvey.html.name: BRSurvey
Classes/BRSurvey.html.abstract: Represents a survey consisting of a series of multiple choice or open ended questions

Classes/BRSurveyAnswer.html.name: BRSurveyAnswer
Classes/BRSurveyAnswer.html.abstract: Represents a multiple choice answer to a survey question

Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html.name: BRSurveyQuestion
Classes/BRSurveyQuestion.html.abstract: Represents a survey question, which is either multiple choice or open-ended

Classes/BRSurveyResponse.html.name: BRSurveyResponse
Classes/BRSurveyResponse.html.abstract: Represents a user response to a survey question

Classes/BRValue.html.name: BRValue
Classes/BRValue.html.abstract: Parent class to hold a value and a confidence

Type%20Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type%20Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
